intro: Erythroxylum brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed copal tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds. Erythroxylum brevipes is part of the Erythroxylaceae family, which includes other plants known for their medicinal and economic importance.
